biography.summary: John A. Barrasso is an American politician serving as the United States Senator from Wyoming, first elected in 2007. A physician by training, he is a member of the Republican Party and has held leadership roles in the Senate, including Senate Republican Conference Chair since 2019 and named Senate Majority Whip in 2025.
biography.education: Bachelor's degree from the University of Wyoming; Doctor of Medicine from Georgetown University School of Medicine.
biography.career: Orthopedic surgeon and physician in Wyoming; served in the Wyoming State Senate before being elected to the U.S. Senate in 2007.

contact.office_address: 307 Dirksen Senate Office Building, Washington, DC 20510
